IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: The South Shore Natural Science Center is a nonprofit organization dedicated to educating the public about the natural and cultural environments of the South Shore. Our mission is to provide natural science experiences that educate, excite, and commit every generation to preserve the environment and to encourage responsible use, stewardship and enjoyment of our natural resources.
IRS990.MissionDescription: The South Shore Natural Science Center is a nonprofit organization dedicated to educating the public about the natural and cultural environments of the South Shore. Our mission is to provide natural science experiences that educate, excite, and commit every generation to preserve the environment and to encourage responsible use, stewardship and enjoyment of our natural resources.
IRS990.Description: To operate a preschool that educates children about the natural and cultural environments of the South Shore.

Activity2.Description: To provide natural science expreiences that educate, excite and commit every generation.

Activity3.Description: To maintain an ecozone and other exhibits to showcase and demonstrate the natural and cultural environments of the South Shore.

ActivityOther.Description: To operate a camp and a nature store that provides experiences and products centralized around the natural and cultural environments of the South Shore.

Form990ScheduleLPartIV.Relationship: Member of Board of Directors and Owner of Printing Company

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 2
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: One of the board members is the owner of a printing company, which the organization uses to prints its newletter.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 6
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The membership is a source of revenue and it also elects the officers.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 7a
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The nominating committee presents the names of potential new members of the governing body at the annual meeting. The membership at large votes on the approval of these governing body members. This is outlined in the corporate bylaws.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 7b
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: At the annual meeting, the membership at large votes on certain significant items as outlined in the corporate bylaws.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Board of directors will review the 990 for accuracy before it is filed. Once it has been approved for filing by the board of directors, the return will be electronically filed.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Each Director, Principal Officer and member of a committee with governing board delegated powers shall annually sign a statement wich affirms such person: 1. Has received a copy of the conflict of interest policy, 2. Has Read and understands the policy and , 3. Has agreed to comply with the policy

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Organization makes its governing documents, conflict of interst policy and financial statements available to the public upon request.
The Board of Directors selects the auditors and approves the audited financials.

NameOfDisregardedEntity.BusinessNameLine1: Melody Woods Curtis Whiting Everson Hobard Reservation
